oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Jimmy Bowen Interview by John Lomax III Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Jimmy Bowen with John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 2-18-83.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jimmy Bowen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:14) -- Jimmy Bowen speaks on the importance of having a creative person in power of a business. (3:30) -- Jimmy Bowen mentions his recent load of stress. (4:00) -- Jimmy Bowen speaks on cutting acts. (5:35) -- John Lomax asks about country music's recent financial struggles. (6:55) -- "They're having success, but they're eating it up with failure." - Jimmy Bowen about pop music. (7:47) -- John Lomax asks Jimmy Bowen about independent promotion. (11:38) -- John Lomax asks Jimmy Bowen about why Nashville became the center for songwriting in country music. (13:18) -- Jimmy Bowen speaks about the open environment of Music Row. (15:13) -- Jimmy Bowen elaborates on why songwriters are attracted to Nashville. (16:28) -- Jimmy Bowen predicts the future of the music industry in Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bowen, Jimmy;
